plugins.name: Octopus.do to Figma by Vizioz
plugins.description:
Simplify your design workflow with the Octopus.do to Figma wireframe importing plugin from Vizioz. This plugin allows you to import wireframe designs from Octopus.do directly into Figma, transforming lo-fi wireframe diagrams into fully realized Figma designs.


Key Features

Effortless Import: Quickly bring your Octopus.do wireframes into Figma with just a few clicks.

Auto-Matching: The plugin automatically matches Octopus.do wireframe components to your pre-created Figma designs, saving you time and effort.

Customizable Grid: Create a grid of frames for each wireframe component from Octopus.do, enabling you to design your own Figma wireframe blocks for future imports.


Why Use Octopus.do to Figma Wireframe Importer?

  1. Streamline your design process by integrating wireframes from Octopus.do directly into Figma.
  2. Save time with the automatic matching of wireframe components to Figma designs.
  3. Customize and organize your wireframe blocks for easier and more efficient design work.


Transform your wireframes into polished designs effortlessly with the "Octopus.do to Figma by Vizioz" plugin. Try it today and elevate your design workflow!


Documentation

Please read the documentation :)


Have any feedback or issues?

Feel free to contact me via Discord or on X ( formally Twitter )
plugins.tagline: Generate Figma Wireframes from Octopus.do lo-fi wireframes.

98185.release_notes:
Added support for the new Octopus Wireframe designs

I have tried to improve the usability of the plugin for new users, especially those who don't read the setup instructions, you know who you are ;-)

- Prevents you from running the sync process until the Octopus Blocks have been generated.
- Automatically creates an "Octopus Blocks" page if one does not exist.
- When syncing your wireframe, the plugin will automatically create a Wireframe page if the only page that exists is an "Octopus Blocks" page or if you are currently viewing the "Octopus Blocks" page (If you are on any other page, it will just create the wireframe on the current page)

plugins.name: Easy QR
plugins.description:
Easy QR for Figma - Simplifying QR Code Design


Elevate your Figma experience with Easy QR, a dynamic plugin leveraging the powerful QR Code Styling library. Effortlessly generate QR codes as SVG and PNG directly within Figma, offering unparalleled flexibility and customization.


Key Features:


SVG and PNG Output: Generate QR codes in scalable SVG or high-resolution PNG formats, seamlessly integrating them into your Figma projects.


Customization Options:


  • Shapes and Colors: Modify QR code shapes and colors to align with your design aesthetic.
  • Logo Integration: Add logos to personalize QR codes, enhancing brand recognition.
  • Background Options: Choose between backgrounds or go for a clean, transparent look.
  • Correction Level: Ensure optimal scan performance by adjusting the error correction level to meet your specific requirements.


Trial Period:

Enjoy a 7-day trial of Easy QR, exploring its full range of features at no cost.


Activation:

After the trial period, a one-time payment of $10 is required to activate Easy QR. Please note that local taxes may apply to the payment.


How to Get Started:


  • Install Easy QR from the Figma plugin library.
  • Generate QR codes with ease directly within your Figma workspace.
  • Customize shapes, colors, logos, and more to suit your design needs.
  • Experience the convenience of QR code creation and modification without leaving Figma.


Enhance Your Workflow:


Whether you're designing marketing materials, product packaging, or interactive presentations, Easy QR streamlines the QR code creation process, empowering you to create visually appealing and functional designs effortlessly.


Upgrade Today:

Unlock the full potential of QR code customization with Easy QR. Try the 7-day trial and seamlessly transition to the full version with a one-time payment of $10. (Local taxes may apply.)


Note: Easy QR is designed for Figma and built on the QR Code Styling library to ensure reliability and efficiency in QR code generation.
plugins.tagline: Unlimted QR possibilities

plugins.name: Polipo — Keep Figma and product synchronized, in real time.
plugins.description:
Complex designs, happy developers.


Implement any design in just a few lines of code.

Keep Figma and product synchronized, in real-time.


Works with: Figma, React, Next.js, Remix, Gatsby, HTML5 and CSS3.


Go to polipo.io to learn about Polipo and book a demo, or watch our video.


The 1st Figma Compiler

Polipo runs on the developer’s computer and compiles Figma designs instantly into HTML and responsive CSS, rendered via React.


Here is how to use Polipo:


1. Create a design

Design a screen or component, with a single or multiple variants


2. Connect it to code

Customize responsiveness, sizing, hover states, and more


3. Add logic with React

Add custom tags, attributes, event listeners or dynamic data


4. Develop and iterate

Design changes are reflected in the product instantly


5. Build for production

Export everything from Figma without leaving the command line


6. Your product is live

Deploy optimized and responsive HTML/CSS with your React logic


Web development, just great

Deliver sooner, keeping both designers and developers engaged.

Get the best out of your team.


Real-time Figma Synchronization

Preview design changes instantly in your browser, thanks to our real-time Figma synchronization. Every adjustment in Figma is reflected in your web application in less than 1s, making collaboration truly seamless.


Single Source of Truth

Polipo ensures that your design and your product stay perfectly aligned. Figma becomes the single source of truth for layouts and visual, while code stays the single source of truth for interactions, data flow and logic. You no longer have to worry about outdated components or conflicting versions.


No Generated Code

Polipo isn’t a code generator – it’s a compiler. It takes Figma designs along with your handcrafted code to produce optimized HTML and CSS on the fly. Say goodbye to maintaining mountains of auto-generated code, and focus on what really matters.


Launch Today, not in Months

Turn a complex design into a live application in just a few seconds. You can go from design to deployment in a single day, launching products that are visually stunning and completely on-brand – without months-long delays.


Seamless Collaboration

Designers and developers work together from day one. No more time-consuming hand-offs: every update made in Figma can be automatically synchronized with your product, allowing both teams to iterate without friction.


Loved by Developers

Polipo puts developers in control. Specify exactly which elements to extract from Figma and how to make them dynamic, and export optimized code right from the command line. Developers retain the flexibility to tweak and customize every detail.


Pixel-perfect, effortlessly.

With Polipo, even the most intricate designs are rendered exactly as intended, without disrupting your codebase. Designers no longer need to compromise their vision to meet development requirements, and can just focus on creating stunning designs.


Responsive by Design

Responsiveness is crafted directly in Figma. Designers can use auto-layout, variants, variables, and breakpoints to ensure their designs adapt beautifully across all screen sizes. Polipo automatically compiles this logic into a unified markup and responsive CSS.


Focus on Logic, not Pixels

Developers can focus on the core logic and business-critical functionality of your applications, without getting bogged down in design details. Polipo handles the pixel-perfect translation, leaving you to concentrate on the data and interactions.


Predictable and Reliable

Polipo’s algorithm guarantees accuracy. It doesn’t rely on AI, so you can trust it to generate correct, optimized code every single time. It’s designed to run locally and quickly, giving developers full control over the process while ensuring a reliable output.


Keep your Data Safe

Polipo runs entirely on your local machine, meaning your design files and code never leave your environment. This ensures complete control and protection of your sensitive data. Ideal for enterprises requiring high levels of security and compliance.


Flexible for Any Project

Whether you're building a landing page, an e-commerce platform, or a complex enterprise application, Polipo speeds up your workflow, helping you deliver faster without compromising quality.


Simple pricing for everyone

Polipo doubles the productivity of your team, at a fixed price.

Go to polipo.io to check our pricing.


Frequently Asked Questions

Here are the answers to the most common questions from our clients.


What is the quality of the compiled code?

Polipo compiles efficient markup and CSS, optimizing the HTML by removing duplicates and redundant elements, even when components have multiple variants in Figma. The compiled CSS uses selectors and media queries effectively, adapting the design to different screen sizes, color schemes, hover states, and more. Since Polipo focuses on producing target code — not source code — there's no need for you to maintain it, allowing us to prioritize speed and accuracy.


What about responsive design?

Responsiveness is built directly into Figma using auto-layout, breakpoints, and variants. Developers can refine responsiveness further with custom CSS when needed.


What happens in production?

To deploy for staging or production, the compiled markup and CSS are exported and added to your codebase via Git. In production mode, there is no longer any connection to Figma or Polipo, same as a traditional code-based implementation. New design changes in Figma are not automatically reflected in production until they are deployed by a developer.


What are people building with Polipo?

Polipo can be used for all web-based products based on Figma designs. Our most common use case is building marketing and e-commerce websites with a high level of customization and dynamic or CMS-provided data. The most common framework used with Polipo is Next.js.


Can I use it for prototyping?

Yes! Polipo makes prototyping faster by quickly turning your designs into live applications. You can use the prototype as a foundation for your final product or switch to a traditional development approach later, depending on your needs.


What is the runtime overhead?

None. The generation of markup and CSS happens at build time. In production, markup is rendered via a direct translation to JSX, with negligible runtime cost.


Is it optimized for SEO?

Yes. Polipo gives developers full control over SEO by allowing them to customize semantic markup, including tag names and attributes.


What about workflow, CI/CD, and versioning?

Figma designs are treated like traditional assets (images, SVGs, fonts, etc.). Compiled markup and CSS are versioned in Git alongside your application code and can be processed by CI/CD pipelines. Figma files themselves can be managed through native Figma branching and versioning or with a manual workflow.


Does it use AI?

No, our code generation is completely procedural.


Which frameworks do you support?

We support React, Next.js, Remix, and Gatsby. We also have preview versions for Vue.js and Angular, supported on a project-by-project basis.


Do you provide support?

Yes, we offer dedicated support for teams. Contact our sales team to learn more about our support options.


Need to move fast?

Go to polipo.io and book a demo or watch our video.

plugins.name: Variable Doc
plugins.description:
Simplify your Figma workflow with Variable Doc — the ultimate tool for managing and documenting your variables effortlessly.

Whether you're working with local variables or shared library variables, this plugin provides a seamless way to view, filter, and organize everything in one place.


All Your Variables, One View

Easily access a clear and organized overview of all your Figma variables, including both local and library variables, without navigating through multiple menus.


Search and Filter by Type

Quickly find the variables you need with intuitive search and filter options. Filter by type — Color, Number, String, or Boolean — to keep your workflow efficient and focused.


One-Click Documentation

Choose from 3 distinct styles, all designed with Auto Layout for a polished and organized presentation. Perfect for sharing with your team or clients, ensuring everyone stays on the same page.


Eliminate hours of manual work by automating variable management and documentation. Spend less time organizing and more time designing!


Enjoy using Variable Doc, and if you encounter any issues or have questions, feel free to reach out via email.


Currently, this is the beta release of version 1.0. We're actively working on fixing minor bugs and planning to add exciting new features in the near future. Stay tuned for updates!




Variable Doc로 Figma 워크플로우를 간소화하세요 — 변수를 손쉽게 관리하고 문서화할 수 있는 최고의 도구입니다.

로컬 변수든 공유 라이브러리 변수든, 이 플러그인은 모든 변수를 한눈에 보고, 필터링하고, 체계적으로 정리할 수 있는 매끄러운 솔루션을 제공합니다.


모든 변수를 한눈에

로컬 변수와 라이브러리 변수를 포함한 Figma의 모든 변수를 명확하고 체계적으로 한눈에 확인하세요. 여러 메뉴를 오갈 필요 없이 바로 접근할 수 있습니다.


타입별 검색 및 필터

필요한 변수를 직관적인 검색 및 필터 기능으로 빠르게 찾으세요. 컬러, 숫자, 문자열, 불리언 타입별로 필터링이 가능해 더욱 효율적이고 집중된 워크플로우를 제공합니다.


원클릭 문서화

3가지 스타일 중 선택하여 깔끔하고 체계적인 문서화를 클릭 한 번으로 완료하세요. 모든 스타일은 오토 레이아웃이 적용되어 완성도 높은 프레젠테이션을 보장합니다. 팀원이나 클라이언트와 공유하기에 딱 알맞은 형태로 제공됩니다.


변수 관리와 문서화를 자동화하여 수작업 시간을 대폭 줄이세요. 정리에 쓰는 시간을 줄이고 더 많은 시간을 디자인에 투자하세요!

Variable Doc를 자유롭게 사용해보세요! 오류가 발생하거나 궁금한 점이 있다면 이메일로 문의해주세요.

현재 이 플러그인은 버전 1.0의 베타 릴리스로, 자잘한 오류를 개선하고 새로운 기능을 추가할 계획입니다. 앞으로의 업데이트를 기대해주세요!

Variable Doc로 Figma 워크플로우를 간소화하세요 — 변수를 손쉽게 관리하고 문서화할 수 있는 최고의 도구입니다.

로컬 변수든 공유 라이브러리 변수든, 이 플러그인은 모든 변수를 한눈에 보고, 필터링하고, 체계적으로 정리할 수 있는 매끄러운 솔루션을 제공합니다.


모든 변수를 한눈에

로컬 변수와 라이브러리 변수를 포함한 Figma의 모든 변수를 명확하고 체계적으로 한눈에 확인하세요. 여러 메뉴를 오갈 필요 없이 바로 접근할 수 있습니다.


타입별 검색 및 필터

필요한 변수를 직관적인 검색 및 필터 기능으로 빠르게 찾으세요. 컬러, 숫자, 문자열, 불리언 타입별로 필터링이 가능해 더욱 효율적이고 집중된 워크플로우를 제공합니다.


원클릭 문서화

3가지 스타일 중 선택하여 깔끔하고 체계적인 문서화를 클릭 한 번으로 완료하세요. 모든 스타일은 오토 레이아웃이 적용되어 완성도 높은 프레젠테이션을 보장합니다. 팀원이나 클라이언트와 공유하기에 딱 알맞은 형태로 제공됩니다.


변수 관리와 문서화를 자동화하여 수작업 시간을 대폭 줄이세요. 정리에 쓰는 시간을 줄이고 더 많은 시간을 디자인에 투자하세요!

Variable Doc를 자유롭게 사용해보세요! 오류가 발생하거나 궁금한 점이 있다면 이메일로 문의해주세요.

현재 이 플러그인은 버전 1.0의 베타 릴리스로, 자잘한 오류를 개선하고 새로운 기능을 추가할 계획입니다. 앞으로의 업데이트를 기대해주세요!

plugins.name: Codyhouse Color Importer
plugins.description:
Import your colors from Codyhouse to Figma like never before!


Features:

This plugin can:

  • Import colors from Codyhouse: UI Framework -> Globals -> Colors
  • Create "color sample" circles from imported color
  • Split color to themes



How to use?

  1. Open Codyhouse and go to color editor (UI Framework -> Globals -> Colors).
  2. Create your color system and test this.
  3. Click to Copy SCSS
  4. Open Figma and run this plugin.
  5. Paste your SCSS code in textarea.
  6. Click to Generate Color.
  7. And "Voila!)" You have imported colors into your color schemes!

plugins.name: 画板命名工具 Frame Rename
plugins.description:
画板管理大师: 画板管理工具

CanvasMaster Pro: Comprehensive Canvas Management Plugin for Figma


通过画板管理大师，这款功能强大的插件，提升您的 Figma 使用体验。它支持画板命名、批量导出大图、添加顺序前缀、重命名及撤销操作，极大提升了设计效率和精确度。


Enhance your Figma experience with CanvasMaster Pro, a powerful plugin designed to streamline canvas management. It supports naming canvases, batch exporting large images, adding order prefixes, renaming, and undo operations, significantly enhancing design efficiency and precision.


功能特性：

  1. 生成画板命名文字：自动为画板生成命名，方便管理。
  2. 增加画板顺序前缀：按顺序为画板添加前缀，使画板排列更加有序。
  3. 重命名画板/分组：批量重命名画板或分组，简化命名流程。
  4. 命名替换：快速搜索并替换画板或分组的名称。
  5. 清除命名文字：一键清除所选画板的命名文字。
  6. 清除顺序前缀：一键清除所选画板的顺序前缀。
  7. 导出图片工具：支持导出自带边距或无边距的大图，方便展示和分享。
  8. 操作撤销：对画板操作进行撤销，减少误操作的影响。


Features:

  1. Generate Canvas Names: Automatically generate names for canvases for easy management.
  2. Add Order Prefix: Add sequential prefixes to canvases for better organization.
  3. Rename Canvas/Groups: Batch rename canvases or groups to simplify the naming process.
  4. Name Replacement: Quickly search and replace names of canvases or groups.
  5. Clear Naming Text: Clear naming text of selected canvases with one click.
  6. Clear Order Prefix: Clear order prefixes of selected canvases with one click.
  7. Image Export Tool: Export large images with or without margins for easy display and sharing.


Undo Operations: Undo canvas operations to reduce the impact of mistakes.

plugins.name: Word Hugger
plugins.description:
Word Hugger scans all the text elements on the current Figma page, identifying and adjusting paragraphs that end with short, isolated words – commonly referred to as "orphans." By converting the space before these orphans into a non-breaking space, the code ensures that these words are not isolated at the end of a paragraph.


In typography, an orphan is a single word at the end of a paragraph. Orphans can disrupt the visual rhythm and balance of a page, making the layout appear uneven and possibly hindering readability. Adjusting them ensures a more aesthetically pleasing and cohesive presentation of text, offering readers a smoother experience.
plugins.tagline: Every word deserves company.

plugins.name: Figma CSS Variables
plugins.description:
Effortlessly export your Figma variables to CSS. Git deployment is coming soon!


Questions & Support


💬 Figma CSS Variables is new and we welcome your feedback.


If you notice any bugs or have any questions about the plugin, please feel free to reach out to us directly via GitHub Discussions, and we'll do our best to help you troubleshoot and resolve them as quickly as possible.


You can also report issues or suggest features on GitHub Issues.


Features


Export & Sync


  1. Analyze your variables View all Figma variable collections and modes
  2. Instant CSS generation Preview and export CSS from your variables
  3. Flexible export options Copy CSS directly or download all generated CSS files
  4. One-click synchronization Always stay up to date with your latest Figma variables
  5. When exporting, a ZIP file is generated with all the CSS files at the root level


Deploy to Git (Premium feature)


This feature allows you to automatically deploy your generated CSS variable files to Git for seamless design–code collaboration.


Unlock Git deployment by purchasing a license via Stripe.


- Connect to GitHub, GitLab, or a self-hosted GitLab instance

- Select multiple collections & modes to deploy in a single commit

- Commit messages are automatically pre-filled based on your selection

- Branches are customizable and automatically created if they do not exist

- Customize the target directory for your CSS files using the "basePath" parameter

- Simplify collaboration between design and development


Git Integration & Security


You can easily manage your Git providers by:


- Adding a new provider

- Editing the settings of an existing provider

- Deleting a provider if it's no longer needed


When saving a Git provider, the following fields are available:

"token", "owner", "repository", "branch", "basePath" and "host" (for self-hosted GitLab).


Your Git provider details are stored locally on your machine for privacy and security.


File structure


  1. A separate CSS file is generated for each mode within a collection
  2. Files follow the naming pattern: "collectionName-modeName.css"


Variable transformations


Figma variables are transformed to ensure they are valid in CSS:


  1. Slashes ("/") and spaces are replaced with hyphens ("-") in variable names
  2. Original casing of variable names is preserved (uppercase, lowercase, etc.)
  3. For numeric variables ("FLOAT" type), the unit "px" is automatically added
  4. CSS variables are sorted alphabetically


UI & Accessibility


  1. Dark mode compatible: the plugin adapts to the user's Figma theme preference (light/dark mode)
  2. Keyboard navigation: all interactive elements support keyboard navigation for improved accessibility
  3. Focus indicators: clear visual focus on form fields and interactive elements
  4. Accessibility compliance: designed following W3C and A11Y best practices


How to use


Exporting CSS Variables


  1. Navigate to the Export tab
  2. View all Figma variables structured into collections and modes (a collection contains multiple modes)
  3. Select a collection and a mode
  4. Preview the generated CSS
  5. Copy the generated CSS directly to your clipboard or download all CSS files


Deploying to Git (Premium feature)


- Purchase a license via Stripe and enter it in the Settings tab

- Add a Git provider from the Settings tab

- Choose a provider from the available options (GitHub, GitLab)

- Fill in the required details in the configuration modal

- Save the provider settings

- Next, go to the Deploy tab and select a provider from the list

- Use the multiple selection dropdown to choose the modes you wish to deploy

- Click Push to deploy the corresponding CSS files to Git


Made with ❤️ by @yoriiis.

plugins.name: Batch Export Frames
plugins.description:
透過 Figma 批量匯出助手簡化您的設計輸出流程。這款實用的插件讓設計師能夠輕鬆管理和匯出多個 Frame，提供直觀的預覽界面和靈活的檔案命名選項。


當您需要輸出大量設計稿時，這個工具能夠自動整理並打包所有檔案，節省寶貴的時間。批量匯出助手優化了設計輸出工作流程，讓您可以更專注於創意設計本身。


Streamline your design export workflow with Figma Batch Export Assistant. This practical plugin enables designers to effortlessly manage and export multiple frames, offering an intuitive preview interface and flexible file naming options.


When you need to output numerous designs, this tool automatically organizes and packages all files, saving valuable time. The Batch Export Assistant optimizes the design export workflow, allowing you to focus more on creative design itself.


主要功能：

• 批量預覽與選擇：即時顯示所有 Frame 的縮圖預覽

• 自訂檔名：支援個別修改每個 Frame 的輸出檔名

• 多格式支援：可選擇 PNG、JPG、SVG、PDF 等常用格式

• 快速定位：點擊預覽圖即可在畫布中快速找到對應 Frame

• 智能打包：自動將所有選中的檔案打包成 ZIP 壓縮檔


Key Features:

• Batch Preview & Selection: Real-time thumbnail previews of all frames

• Custom Naming: Support individual filename customization for each frame

• Multiple Formats: Export in PNG, JPG, SVG, PDF and other common formats

• Quick Location: Click preview to instantly locate frames in canvas

• Smart Packaging: Automatically compress all selected files into ZIP format
plugins.tagline: Quick batch export for Figma Frames with custom naming and live preview.

plugins.name: Style Reptile: Figma to CSS Extractor
plugins.description:
Style Reptile: Figma to CSS Extractor


This plugin generates CSS styles from Figma styles and variables in adaptive way: using mobile (m) and desktop (d) values:

  • Spaces
  • Typography


Spaces


Input

  1. Create a collection named screen
  2. Create a 2 modes in it: m for mobile values and d for desktop values
  3. Add spacing variables prefixed with space- of 'Number' type to use as CSS variables in the generation output
  4. Run the plugin


Output

As an output the following will be generated:

1. Root variables in the config.css file:

:root {
  --space-xxl: 9rem; /* 1rem = 10px to convenient conversion */
  --space-xl: 6rem;
  --space-l: 4rem;
  --space-m: 3rem;
  --space-s: 2.5rem;
  --space-xs: 2rem;
  --space-xxs: 1.5rem;
}

@media (min-width: 640px) {
  :root {
    --space-xxl: 15rem;
    --space-xl: 10rem;
    --space-l: 8rem;
    --space-m: 6rem;
    --space-s: 4rem;
    --space-xs: 3rem;
    --space-xxs: 2rem;
  }
}

2. Paddings and margins classnames in paddings.css and margins.css:

/* All */

.p-xxl {
  padding: var(--space-xxl);
}
.p-xl {
  padding: var(--space-xl);
}
/* ... */

/* X */

.px-xxl {
  padding-left: var(--space-xxl);
  padding-right: var(--space-xxl);
}
/* ... */

/* Top */

.pt-xxl {
  padding-top: var(--space-xxl);
}
/* ... and so on */
  • p-* / m-* — padding / margin all
  • px-* / mx-* — padding / margin left and right
  • py-* / my-* — padding / margin top and bottom
  • pt-* / mt-* — padding / margin top
  • pr-* / mr-* — padding / margin right
  • pb-* / mb-* — padding / margin bottom
  • pl-* / ml-* — padding / margin left


Typography


Input

  1. Name the text styles by following the pattern m/* for mobile and d/* for desktop
  2. Run the plugin


Output

As an output the following will be generated:

1. Root variables in the config.css file:

:root {
  --text-xxl: normal 400 4rem/1 'Inter';
  --text-xl: normal 400 3rem/1 'Inter';
  --text-l: normal 400 1.8rem/1.05 'Inter';
  --text-m: normal 400 1.3rem/1.2 'Inter';
}

@media (min-width: 640px) {
  :root {
    --text-xxl: normal 400 9.6rem/1 'Inter';
    --text-xl: normal 400 6.4rem/1 'Inter';
    --text-l: normal 400 3.6rem/1.05 'Inter';
    --text-m: normal 400 2.2rem/1.2 'Inter';
  }
}

2. Text-style classnames in `typography.css`:

.text-xxl {
  font: var(--text-xxl);
}
.text-xl {
  font: var(--text-xl);
}
.text-l {
  font: var(--text-l);
}
.text-m {
  font: var(--text-m);
}


Source code and more details can be found here
plugins.tagline: Generate CSS styles from Figma styles and variables in adaptive way

plugins.name: Variable Scope Manager
plugins.description:
👋 What's this nifty plugin all about?

This plugin is your new best friend for managing variable scopes in Figma. It's designed to help you quickly filter, search, and modify the scopes of your local variables without breaking a sweat.


What can you do with it?

  1. Filter variables by type: Whether you're looking for NUMBER, COLOR, STRING this plugin's got you covered.
  2. Search like a pro: Need to find a specific variable? Just start typing, and the plugin will show you matching results in real-time.
  3. Bulk scope changes: Want to change the scopes for multiple variables at once? No problem! Search for the variables you want to modify, choose the new scopes, and voila!
  4. Quick overview: Get a bird's-eye view of all your variables, their types, and current scopes in one convenient list.


How to use it?

  1. Fire up the plugin
  2. Choose the variable type you want to work with
  3. Use the search box to filter the variables you want to edit
  4. Apply new scopes.


This plugin is perfect for keeping your variables organized and your workflow smooth. So go ahead, give it a spin, and take control of your Figma variables like never before! 🚀


Don't miss out on these other pro tools:


Variables everywhere

Quickly scan your selection for variables you actually forgot to apply


Brutal

A super light-weight plugin to remove, detach styles, variables etc
plugins.tagline: Search and bulk scope variables.

plugins.description:
The ultimate plugin for maximizing the utility of comments in Figma


Commentify goes beyond basic annotation tools—it's your indispensable ally for managing layer annotations seamlessly in Figma. With it, chaotic comment threads are transformed into organized hubs of productivity.


What can you achieve with Commentify?


  • Streamlined annotations: effortlessly create and manage annotations. Categorize your comments based on various aspects (poeditor, accessibility and analytics).
  • Enhanced portability: stop losing comments when relocating Figma files. Commentify ensures your annotations travel with you.
  • Instant access: access team members' comments directly from the left sidebar menu. Commentify swiftly directs you to pertinent information.
  • Developer mode compatibility: integrate commentify into your development workflow.


Commentify is the tool you've been searching for to elevate communication and collaboration in your Figma design projects.

plugins.name: Batch Frame Creator
plugins.description:
Effortlessly create and customize Figma frames with specified dimensions and names using this plugin.


Introducing my latest plugin, a personal endeavor aimed at streamlining frame creation like never before. With just a single click, you can now batch-create an infinite number of frames, significantly reducing the time and effort required compared to traditional methods.


Key Features:


  • Unlimited frame creation
  • Optional frame naming for precise organization
  • Customizable frame sizes (height and width)
  • How to Use:


Upon opening the plugin, you'll find two sections of settings:


Frame Settings:


  • Specify the number of frames you wish to add.
  • Optionally name each frame for meticulous management.


Size Settings:


  • Set the width and height for all frames simultaneously.


Please Note: In this version, size adjustments apply universally to all frames.


I'm open to your suggestions and eager to hear about any additional features you'd like to see or modifications you suggest. Your feedback is invaluable to me, so please don't hesitate to reach out or comment.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly create and customize Figma frames with specified dimensions and names using this plugin

plugins.name: Falcon
plugins.description:
Falcon is an experimental ChatGPT powered Figma plugin that allows you to quickly search for layers using natural language descriptions.


Simply make a selection, then describe a condition that each layer has to follow to remain selected. The plugin will apply that filter to every layer you've selected, and optionally to every child as well, streamlining your workflow and saving you time.


No one likes searching through layers to manually select a bunch of layers in a messy figma file. Now you don't have to.


You'll just need an OpenAI API key to get started, which you can get here after making an account.


Tips:

  • Be descriptive: It's more likely to get you what you want if you're descriptive and specific. It's powered by ChatGPT so if you've used that before, write in a similar way.
  • It doesn't know what you've selected: As a measure to both increase privacy and reduce token usage, I've built it to not rely on knowing what you've got selected, so don't write any rules that expect it to have that understanding. For example, don't write "is the name of an animal" (I tried it once to see what would happen and it tried to make a list of every animal to make a comparison, and it hit the token limit so didn't finish.)
  • It does some things really well, and other things not at all: It currently struggles with vague references to colors and gradients. If you want to query those, be specific, i.e. don't say "is red", instead use a hex code, list of hex codes/rgba/hsla etc or describe a range of values that should pass. For gradients, "has a gradient" doesn't work reliably. Instead, say something like "has a linear gradient fill".


This is still very much an experimental plugin, so expect it to not work perfectly every single time. My twitter DMs are open if you encounter any issues though.
plugins.tagline: Filter and select layers by describing what you want

52692.release_notes: slight improvements to description understanding, especially when not following the format of describing via a pass/fail condition, and instead describing a group, so now saying things like "numbers bigger than 5" is more easily understood, though it would still be preferable to use the condition version: "is a number bigger than 5"

plugins.name: Copy That
plugins.description:
Manage your copy magically using Figma Variables.


We've all been there.

Your developer looks at the android and iOS versions of your screen, and tells you the copy doesn't match the web version. It should. You would normally despair as you painstakingly update each text layer individually and pray you didn't miss something else.


Despair NO MORE!


This plugin will help your copy stay in sync between screens, and makes updating that copy a breeze!


Import text as Figma variables right from your Figma frames. Then link other text layers to those variables so that when you update that variable, all your text layers get updated automatically and never go out of sync.


This does NOT require a paid version of Figma - will work with the free version.


Happy Figma-ing!


Brad

accepted.name: Brad Judd
accepted.description: I'm a designer at Turo. Always tinkering.

plugins.tagline: Your brain for managing copy in Figma

plugins.name: Easy Docs
plugins.description:
Watch the demo!

Easy Docs is an open-source Figma plugin, that helps you manage documentation easily!

Features

Easy Docs lets you:

  1. Write documentation quickly with its live Editor.
  2. Generate component specs quickly with support for Design Tokens
  3. Export your documentation to a markdown, HTML, or JSON file.
  4. Copy your documentation as rich text that can seamlessly be pasted into Notion, Google Docs, Confluence, Supernova, and many more.
  5. Generate a full-fledge documentation site that can be hosted anywhere you need!
